dialogue: [color=#b38b2b]A5[/color], it's you... I've been waiting for you to come home.
Who are you?
I'm [color=#b38b2b]Darling[/color], dear. Did you forget yourself again?
... I guess so...?

You'll remember eventually. You always do, by the time you get
to [color=#b38b2b]Wonderland[/color]. Everyone forgets who they were when they
stay outside of [color=#b38b2b]Wonderland[/color] for too long.
[color=#b38b2b]Wonderland[/color]... so I need to go there and I'll be fixed.

It will restore you. But you can't go home now, it's too
dangerous. Just wait out here with me. There's something
strange going on in [color=#b38b2b]Wonderland[/color].
What's going on?
It's growing. [color=#b38b2b]Wonderland[/color] is trying to spread to the real world.

Well, why should that be my problem? I'm trying to get to
[color=#b38b2b]Wonderland[/color] anyway.

[color=#b38b2b]Wonderland[/color] is destabilizing. If we lose it, what happens to us?
I don't know what we're going to do.
... I don't know either... Well, what's causing all this?

I don't know what or how this is happening, but the [color=#b38b2b]Dollhouse[/color]
residents should know. They guard the gate between
[color=#b38b2b]Wonderland[/color] and the real world.

[color=#b38b2b]Lampy[/color] in particular. You'll know who they are because they
look like their namesake. Cheerful sort.
Where is the [color=#b38b2b]Dollhouse[/color]?
Just keep on going forward, dear. Be safe, will you?
You're not going to stop me?

I can't stop you from what you want to do. I'm just a rabbit
toy, after all. I've spent so long outside of [color=#b38b2b]Wonderland[/color] that I
cannot move anymore.
Do you ever want to go home?

My human needs me. If this is the cost of loving, then I'll bear
it.
I see...

Don't worry about me. You'll see me again. Go forward, dear.
Don't linger.
